page.title: 03Communication in Hannington
page.content: }The village has its milk delivered daily by the local Jobs Dairy motor van _ the electric milk float general_ ly used in & around Basingstoke is not strong enough to cope with the terrain _ Sunday's milk is delivered with the Saturday quota but the Milkman is kept busy on Sundays delivering newspapers only. There are three boxes in the village for outgoing letters which are collected twice daily and once on Sat_ urday at the same time as the Postman brings the mail. Our one telephone box is situated outside our only Public House. Opposite, is the village hall, where the Post Office Officials come once a week for one hour to allow the villagers to collect Pensions etc., A travelling library calls once a week also mobile shop services.
